title: After a year of one tricking Taliyah, I would think I'd get use to her current W.

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body:
TL;DR {{champion:163}}'s W still feels terrible. Giving it QoL fixes or a revert to Double Cast without Lockout would be very appreciated. 

People said to "Get used to it." on July 13, 2016 when there were lots of complaints about the change to {{champion:163}}'s W. I gave it a chance since I was probably being impulsive and selfish about it.

Boy was I wrong.

It still feels exceedingly clunky and annoying to use as the game becomes progressively quicker-paced and a missed CC skill will make or break a fight. No, it's not because I don't win with her or that I perform poorly with her, thus motivating me to make a post like this. If anything, I win more with her than any other champion I have played in League. 

It's the fact that Vector Cast and the lack of a proper targeting reticle feels terrible for a skill like Seismic Shove. It's her main CC skill. It should be more polished than it is right now. Plus I'm a visual learner (Hence why I use Normal Cast to see where I'm aiming my skills in a fight), so I process things better visually. A proper AoE targeting reticle helps a bunch with aiming and I'm sure many people will agree. 

At this point, I would definitely take the old Double Cast W back. NOT THE LOCKOUT. The Double Cast paradigm. It feels so much better to use than the current one does. It had:

* Max Range Cast so it wont force {{champion:163}} out of position just to cast it out of range. 
* A proper targeting reticle.
* The flexibility to knockup or shove.

The current W allows {{champion:163}} to shove by performing one action. That's it. The current W has none of what is listed and it feels like a slap to the family jewels when I saw these aspects being removed. Worst part is, Vector Cast will not ever have Max Range Cast or the flexibility to knockup or shove due to the nature of the cast paradigm. Unless tweaks are made. 

Don't get me wrong. I still love everything about {{champion:163}} and will continue playing her, but I want to make her feel good to play as much as possible. Her W sticks out like a sore thumb compared to the rest of her fluid kit due to its awkward and outdated casting paradigm. 

Either revert it back to patch 6.13's version of Seismic Shove or give it a proper targeting reticle and make it work like pings and see how that goes. I can guarantee people will start giving her a try more.

They changed Seismic Shove from being cast like {{champion:31}}'s Q to being cast like {{champion:112}}'s E. It's nonsensical and frustrating because it's an AoE circle knockup, so it should be cast like {{champion:31}}'s Q since they're both AoE circle knockups. An AoE circle knockup being programmed to aim like a linear line skill shot such as {{champion:112}}'s E simply doesn't feel good for many reasons.

Ah yes, the damn W change.......there's a lot of Riot's shit I'm willing to put up with, this is not one of them.

They take a perfectly fine champ & ruined her because they listened to people who played her once rather than the people who put a lot of time into learning her kit & mained her. I was having so much fun with her. Even when her win rate was utter shit & no one was playing her, I put so much time into playing that she became one of my most played champs in 2016 (remember that 2016 review thing?) & I got to Mastery 6 with her.

But once those W changes drop, it became a struggle just to play her. That damn W is fighting against me everytime. It's the most important part of her combo & I can't even fucking rely on it. Every once in a while I do try her again to reclaim some of that old spark, I learn that it's just not there.

I had some fun times with Taliyah. I guess those times are over.

I feel like her w now is a whole lot better than before the change, in my opinion. It's just so much more reactive for vector cast, than it is to double cast. If they were somehow able to add max range cast to vector cast, it would be perfect.

actually with the double cast her w casted faster then with vector casting. With the double cast the ability cast as soon as you hit the w key. with vector casting the game has to wait until you draw the line before the ability casts. this is at least .15-.25 seconds longer depending on how long it takes you to do that.
Double cast depends on how fast you double tap. That is much slower than moving your wrist slightly in a direction.

Incorrect. With double cast the ability casted as soon as you hit w the first time. Then you had the .5-.75 seconds during the cast time to move your curser and click again. Otherwise it would simply knock straight up. With vecter casting it doesn't cast until you finish the drag which is always going to be slower then simply clicking the first time.

> [{quoted}](name=Barkingspider73,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=YZqNhWO1,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-07-22T09:23:59.684+0000)
>
> I feel like her w now is a whole lot better than before the change, in my opinion. It's just so much more reactive for vector cast, than it is to double cast. If they were somehow able to add max range cast to vector cast, it would be perfect.

I would be fine with that too, but unfortunately it's not very possible. When I thought about how many things Vector Cast can't have due to how it works, I just figured that it isn't really fit for a skill like Seismic Shove.

I miss the Double Cast as well. Although Taliyah''s kit as a whole is still one of the more fluid ones out there, changing Seismic Shove to a Vector Cast made everything feel really sticky and hard to use.

The only part that didn't feel fluid on her before is that you couldn't flash or cast any spells during the cast time of w. But once you got used to that it was a super fun kit. I feel like they simply could have removed that lockout and allowed us to flash and cast q and her kit would have been fine.

I've played her since release, and while it took me a few practice combos in bot games to get used to her W, it feels perfectly fine to me. This new change breathes new life into her by giving her more versatility through another, sometimes unexpected burst combo. If you know how to use it correctly, it feels neither clunky nor annoying to use. The only issue I have with it is that I have to guess how large the radius of the W is sometimes. 

There is no reason for Riot to revert changes that happened over a year ago. If anything, they should adjust it or make a new form of casting type for her W. Perhaps I am in the minority in NA, but I thought her old W was much more difficult to use than the new one; it also felt much clunkier and worse to use, especially once I got used to the new W.

Nope, I agree with you.  The old W felt incredibly clunky and disconnected.  In my experience, it felt bad for everyone.  I'd sometimes cast the first part just before I got stunned, so I'd be able to knock them back while I'm cced.  It confused many opponents and felt generally uncomfortable to me.

I enjoy the current version so much more (and I have played plenty of Taliyah even if she is not my main).

I would play her again if there was some way to choose which casting type you wanted. I can't stand the new casting type on her w. But if there was a way to use the old casting I would play her again.

Unfortunately I don't think that's possible with the way the game is coded.  The only way I could think of them doing it is if they made her 2 "separate" champions (so you pick the one with the W you want) with which the ban or pick of one would block both.
As true as that may be it would be nice to simply have the option to chance the cast type in the setting right next the quick cast and all that.
I know this isn't something that would happen, but wouldn't it be hilarious if they reverted it and tied the vector-cast version to a skin called "Vectorious Taliyah"? xD
Sooo clunky, it's the reason I stopped playing her.
